newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Irish government proposes Robinson for U.N. job.
newsitem.headline: Irish government proposes Robinson for U.N. job.

text.p: The Irish government on Wednesday formally proposed President Mary Robinson for the post of United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights.
A cabinet statement said the government would "actively support the President's candidature in every possible way."
Robinson announced last week that she would not be seeking reelection as president, a job she has held for nearly eight years.
She said at the weekend that the government had expressed support for her name going forward to fill the U.N. human rights post when it became vacant, which is expected to be soon.
Robinson is a trained constitutional lawyer who has spent a good deal of her professional life publicising Third World causes, notably in Africa.
